messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Sandy Hook School. I think there's somebody shooting in here.
Okay. What makes you think that?
Because somebody's got a gun. I saw a glimpse of somebody running down the hallway.
Alright, where are you in the school right now?
I'm down the corridor.
I want you to take cover and stay on the line. What about the students in the front of the building?
Everything's locked up as far as I know. I'm not in the front.
Did you see anything out the window?
No, it's still going on. I keep hearing shooting.
Okay, I don't want you to go over there. I want to know what's happening with the students along the front corridor.
I'm not in the front. I'm actually in another part of the school.
Do you see or hear anything more at this time?
I keep hearing popping sounds.
Alright, stay with me. Who am I speaking with?
Rick Storm.
Rick, what's your position at the school?
I'm acting head custodian today.
Rick, are all the doors locked and are classrooms secure?
Yes, all the rooms are locked.
Did you see anything before this started?
No, but the gym teacher told me he saw a shadow past the gym.
Was this shadow inside or outside?
Outside.
Are there any injuries at this time?
I don't know of any injuries right now.
Alright, Rick, I'm going to keep you on the line. Are you still hearing shooting?
It's silent now.
Okay, stay where you are. Help is on the way. Can you give me an update on your surroundings in a few seconds?
Okay.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
This is the state police. I got a victim from Sandy Hook School. She’s been shot in the foot.
Where is she located?
Room number one, near the playground.
How close are you to arriving on scene?
We're very close.
Alright, thanks. Stay safe.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, my friend just texted me. She's at Sandy Hook Elementary. There’s a shooting.
Okay, we have officers on scene. Thank you.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
This is Brosey from Newtown. Do you know what's happening?
Yes, we’re aware. There’s an active shooter. We have help on the way.
Thanks.
Rick, are you still with me?
Yes, I’m here.
Alright, what do you see now?
I'm in the corridor. I'm not seeing anybody, but I hear talking.
Stay on the line and stay safe. Let the officers know you’re on the phone with 9-1-1.
I will.
Alright, Rick, I'm going to keep you with me. Do you hear any more shooting?
Not right now.
Okay. Hang tight, help is very close.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Sandy Hook School. My friend just texted me. There’s a shooter.
We have responders on scene now. Thank you.
